thread.title: JBT Corporation Q2 revenue up 2.8% YoY
thread.title_full: JBT Corporation Q2 revenue up 2.8% YoY

author: Gulli Arnason
title: JBT Corporation Q2 revenue up 2.8% YoY
text:
Air and Travel · 
  of 2.8 percent from the second quarter of 2014.On a constant currency basis, revenue increased 10.8 percent year over year. Segment operating profit increased 8.5 percent, or 19.6 percent on a constant currency basis, with margin expansion at both FoodTech and AeroTech. Corporate expense for the quarter was USD7.6 million compared to USD8.9 million in the year-ago period. In the second quarter of 2014, corporate expense included management succession and consulting costs of USD2.1 million.Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD0.48 versus USD0.38 in the prior-year period. Excluding restructuring charges of USD1.0 million and the aforementioned management succession and consulting costs, adjusted diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD0.45 in the prior-year period. “JBT delivered another good quarter, with healthy inbound orders and continued progress on our Next Level initiatives,” said Tom Giacomini, Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer. “In July, we announced an agreement to acquire Stork Food & Dairy Systems, an addition that significantly enhances JBT´s Liquid Foods business.”JBT is a leading global technology solutions provider to the food processing and air transportation industries.
